There were some good fight moves in the film - you have to remember that it is not an action movie, but rather payed homage to classic Italian films of that genre. I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. Some people may disagree with me on this title, saying that the story is way to hateful to be liked and that the characters do not have anything good. If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The peculiarity starts when the sky turns red during the full moon. A short story by Stephen King, released as an adaptation to this horror themed book.
